name: conversations.acceptSharedInvite
desc: Accepts an invitation to a Slack Connect channel.

channel_id.desc: ID of the channel that you'd like to accept. Must provide either invite_id or channel_id.

channel_name.desc: Name of the channel. If the channel does not exist already in your workspace, this name is the one that the channel will take.

free_trial_accepted.desc: Whether you'd like to use your workspace's free trial to begin using Slack Connect.

invite_id.desc: ID of the invite that you'd like to accept. Must provide either invite_id or channel_id. See the shared_channel_invite_received event payload for more details on how to retrieve the ID of the invitation.

is_private.desc: Whether the channel should be private.

team_id.desc: The ID of the workspace to accept the channel in. If an org-level token is used to call this method, the team_id argument is required.

errors.channel_conversion_in_progress: Unable to create a channel connection while a channel conversion is in progress
errors.connection_limit_exceeded: This channel has hit the limit of external connections.
errors.email_does_not_match: User's email does not match the email in the invite.
errors.failed_to_start_trial: Unable to initiate a trial on shared invite acceptance
errors.has_already_connected_to_org: A team on the workspace of the org is already in the channel.
errors.invalid_arguments: Invalid API arguments were provided. Either `sig` or `invite_id` must be specified.
errors.invalid_link: We couldn't find an invite associated with the ID provided.
errors.invalid_name: The value passed for `channel_name` was invalid.
errors.invalid_name_maxlength: The value passed for `channel_name` exceeded the maximum length.
errors.invalid_name_punctuation: The value passed for `channel_name` contained only punctuation.
errors.invalid_name_required: The value passed for `channel_name` was empty.
errors.invalid_name_specials: The value passed for `channel_name` contained unallowed special characters or upper case characters.
errors.invite_from_same_org: You can't accept an invite from the same org or workspace.
errors.invite_not_found: We couldn't find a Slack Connect channel invite with the ID provided.
errors.invalid_privacy: An invalid channel privacy was provided.
errors.invalid_recipient_team: The accepting team does not match the expected recipient team.
errors.invite_used: This invite has already been accepted.
errors.is_pending_connected_to_org: A team pending to join the channel is on the org of the team trying to accept.
errors.legacy_connection_invalid_org: Teams not previously connected to this legacy channel can't connect.
errors.legacy_connection_limit_exceeded: You cannot share a legacy ESC channel with a third team
errors.name_taken: The desired channel name is already taken in your workspace.
errors.not_allowed_for_grid_workspace: Acceptance is not allowed for this workspace.
errors.not_paid: This workspace doesn't have access to this feature.
errors.restricted_action: A team preference prevents the authenticated user from creating private channels.
errors.team_not_found: The team provided in the `team_id` argument does not exits.
errors.user_cannot_create_channel: This user is not allowed to create a channel.
errors.user_is_restricted: This user is restricted and cannot accept the invite.
errors.user_not_found: The user accepting the invite is not a member of the team provided in the `team_id` argument.
errors.user_required_to_accept_as_private_but_c: This uer cannot accept a private channel invitation.
